搬.definition: to move (i.e. relocate oneself); to move (sth relatively heavy or bulky); to shift; to copy indiscriminately

搬兵.definition: to call for reinforcements; to bring in troops

搬出去.definition: to move out (vacate); to shift sth out

搬動.definition: to move (sth) around; to move house

搬口.definition: to pass on stories (idiom); to sow dissension; to blab; to tell tales

搬唇遞舌.definition: to pass on stories (idiom); to sow dissension; to blab; to tell tales

搬家.definition: to move house; to relocate; to remove (sth)

搬弄.definition: to fiddle with; to play and move sth about; to show off (what one can do); to parade (one's capabilities); to cause trouble

搬弄是非.definition: to incite a quarrel (idiom); to sow discord between people; to tell tales; to make mischief

搬楦頭.definition: lit. to move the shoes on the shoe tree (idiom); fig. to expose shameful secrets (old)

搬用.definition: to apply mechanically; to copy and use

搬石頭砸自己的腳.pinyin: ban1 shi2 tou5 za2 zi4 ji3 de5 jiao3
搬石頭砸自己的腳.definition: to move a stone and stub one's toe; to shoot oneself in the foot (idiom)

搬磚.definition: to do hard physical labor (as a job); (fig.) to play mahjong

搬磚砸腳.definition: to hurt oneself by one's own doing; to boomerang; to shoot oneself in the foot (idiom)

搬起石頭砸自己的腳.pinyin: ban1 qi3 shi2 tou5 za2 zi4 ji3 de5 jiao3
搬起石頭砸自己的腳.definition: to crush one's own foot while trying to maneuver a rock (to a cliff edge, to drop on one's enemy) (idiom); hoisted by one's own petard

搬運.definition: freight; transport; portage; to transport; to carry

搬遷戶.definition: person or household that has to be relocated (to make way for a construction project etc)
